sen.j: 秦楽寺（じんらくじ）とは、奈良県磯城郡田原本町秦庄にある真言律宗の寺。
sen.e: Jinraku-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple of Shingon Ritsu sect in Hatanosho, Shiki-gun Tawaramoto-cho, Nara prefecture.
sen.cmt: 奈良県磯城郡田原本町秦庄:英語でのこの地域の住所標記方法は郵便局のウェブサイト参照：http://www.yuubinkun.com/%E9%83%B5%E4%BE%BF%E7%95%AA%E5%8F%B7/%E5%A5%88%E8%89%AF%E7%9C%8C/%E7%A3%AF%E5%9F%8E%E9%83%A1%E7%94%B0%E5%8E%9F%E6%9C%AC%E7%94%BA/%E7%A7%A6%E5%BA%84/6360343.html
sen.e: Jinraku-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple of the Shingon Ritsu sect in Hatanosho, Shiki-gun Tawaramoto-cho, Nara prefecture.
Jinraku-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple of the Shingon Ritsu sect in Hatanosho, Shiki-gun Tawaramoto-cho, Nara prefecture.

sen.j: 号は高日山浄土院。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain and unit prefix is Takahiyama Jodo-in temple.
sen.cmt: 『号』とありますが、和文では山号および院号が含まれていますので、意味を取って訳しました。
sen.e: Its honorific Buddhist name is 'Takahiyama Jodo-in.'
Its honorific Buddhist name is 'Takahiyama Jodo-in.'

sen.j: 門は珍しい中国風の白色が美しい土蔵門である。
sen.e: Its front gate is a beautiful white earthen gate in Chinese-style.
Its front gate is rare Chinese-style white earthen gate.
Its front gate is rare Chinese-style white earthen gate.

sen.j: 本尊は平安時代作の千手観音。
sen.e: The principal object of worship at this temple is Senju Kannon (thousand-armed goddess of mercy) made in Heian period.
sen.cmt: 『千手観音』は読み手に音と意味がわかるように音訳の後、括弧をつけて意味を訳しました。
sen.e: The principal object of worship at the temple is Senju Kannon (thousand-armed goddess of mercy) made in the Heian period.
The principal object of worship at the temple is Senju Kannon (thousand-armed goddess of mercy) made in the Heian period.

sen.j: 本尊の向かって右に聖徳太子像、左に秦河勝像を安置する。
sen.e: Shotoku Taishi zo (statue of Prince Shotoku) is enshrined on the right of the principal object of worship as one faces, and so is HATA no Kawakatsu zo (statue of HATA no Kawakatsu) on the left.

A statue of Shotoku Taishi (Prince Shotoku) is stands to the right of the principal object of worship when faced head on, and a statue of HATA no Kawakatsu (statue of HATA no Kawakatsu) stands to its left.

A statue of Shotoku Taishi (Prince Shotoku) is stands to the right of the principal object of worship when faced head on, and a statue of HATA no Kawakatsu (statue of HATA no Kawakatsu) stands to its left.

sen.j: 秦河勝像の台座には明暦元年（1655年）9月14日_(旧暦)と多武峯住 藤室法印良盛の銘がある。
sen.e: On the pedestal of HATA no Kawakatsu zo, there are inscriptions of September 14, 1665 and 多武峯住 藤室法印良盛, (a name of high-ranked Buddhist priest lived in Tonomine, Nara prefecture).
sen.cmt: 『多武峯住 藤室法印良盛』読み仮名不明おそらく『多武峯(とうのみね)に住む、高位にある僧侶(=法印)藤室良盛』ではないかと考えられますが、インターネット検索では確証は得られませんでした。『藤室法印良盛』の表記方法は「京都プロジェクト案件 用語共有」には"Yoshimori TOSHITSU HOIN"とありますが、12世紀から13世紀にかけて奈良県に『良盛』と書いて『りょうせい』と読む僧侶が居たことから『りょうせい』と読む可能性も捨て切れませんでしたので、原文通り和文表記にし、その後に括弧をつけて上記の推測内容を付記しました。
sen.e: On the pedestal of the HATA no Kawakatsu statue, there are inscriptions of September 14, 1665 and 多武峯住 藤室法印良盛, (a name of high-ranked Buddhist priest who lived in Tonomine, Nara prefecture).
On the pedestal of the HATA no Kawakatsu statue, there are inscriptions of September 14, 1665 and 多武峯住 藤室法印良盛, (a name of high-ranked Buddhist priest who lived in Tonomine, Nara prefecture).

sen.j: 寺伝では、大化3年（647年）、百済王から贈られ、聖徳太子から秦河勝に下賜された観音を当地に安置したことにはじまるという。
sen.e: According to the temple history, the beginning of this temple is when the Kannon statue was enshrined there in 647, which was given from King of Paekche to Prince Shotoku and later granted to Hata no Kawakatsu,

According to the temple history, the temple began when the Kannon statue, which was given from King of Paekche to Prince Shotoku and later granted to Hata no Kawakatsu, was housed there in the year 647.

According to the temple history, the temple began when the Kannon statue, which was given from King of Paekche to Prince Shotoku and later granted to Hata no Kawakatsu, was housed there in the year 647.

sen.j: 聖徳太子が、斑鳩から都に通った道であると伝えられる大和の古道（太子道）は、寺の少し北を通過し、近い。
sen.e: The ancient path in Yamato Province (Taishi-michi path), along which Prince Shotoku supposedly commuted from Ikaruga to the capital (of Nara), goes a little North not far from this temple.
sen.cmt: 『都』はここでは奈良の都を指すと思われますので、括弧をつけて『奈良の』と付記しました。
sen.e: The ancient path in Yamato Province (Taishi-michi path), along which Prince Shotoku supposedly commuted from Ikaruga to the capital (of Nara), passes slightly to the north of the temple.
sen.cmt: goes a little north not far from this temple > passes slightly to the north of the temple.
sen.e: The ancient path in Yamato Province (Taishi-michi path), along which Prince Shotoku supposedly commuted from Ikaruga to the capital (of Nara), passes slightly to the north of the temple.

sen.j: 大同_(日本)2年（807年）、唐から帰国した空海が、境内に梵字の「阿」の形の池を作ったとされている。
sen.e: It is said that, in 807, Kukai made a pond in the form of "阿", one of Sanskrit characters (pronounced as [ə]), in the temple on his return from China.
sen.cmt: ここでは「阿」の文字の形そのものに意味がありますので、敢えてそのまま漢字で記しました。 また次の文章で読み方が関わってきますので、発音記号を加えました。
sen.e: It is said that, in 807, Kukai made a pond in the form of the '阿' character, one of Sanskrit sounds (pronounced as [ə]), at the temple on his return from China.
It is said that, in 807, Kukai made a pond in the form of the '阿' character, one of Sanskrit sounds (pronounced as [ə]), at the temple on his return from China.

sen.j: この阿字池は、7～8月に咲く蓮の花で有名。
sen.e: This Ajino-ike Pond (阿-character shaped pond) is famous for its lotus flowers that blossom in July and August.
sen.cmt: 阿字池は和文では前文内容から推測することが容易ですが、英文のみをローマ字で読んだ場合には繋がりが弱いので括弧内に意味を補足しました。
sen.e: This Ajino-ike Pond (lit. 阿-character shaped pond) is famous for its lotus flowers that blossom in July and August.
This Ajino-ike Pond (lit. 阿-character shaped pond) is famous for its lotus flowers that blossom in July and August.

sen.j: また、空海はこの寺で「三教指帰（さんごうしいき）」を書いたとの伝えがある。
sen.e: Also, there is a legend which says that Kukai wrote "Sangoshiiki" (the three-episodes long story that indicates differences between the goals of Confucianism, Taoism and Buddhism) at this temple.
sen.cmt: 「三教指帰」定訳不明。ローマ字だけでは意味が伝わらないので括弧内にタイトルが示す意味を追記しました。
sen.e: Also, there is a legend which states that Kukai wrote "Sangoshiiki" (a three-episode long story that indicates differences between the goals of Confucianism, Taoism and Buddhism) at this temple.
Also, there is a legend which states that Kukai wrote "Sangoshiiki" (a three-episode long story that indicates differences between the goals of Confucianism, Taoism and Buddhism) at this temple.

sen.j: さらに、空海が、執筆中、阿字池のカエルが騒がしく鳴き、静かにするように叱ったので、それ以来騒がしく鳴かない、という伝説がある。
sen.e: Furthermore, another legend says that, when he was writing, Kukai rebuked frogs and told them to be quiet because they were croaking noisily, and so that frogs at Anoji-ike Pond would not croak loudly ever since.

Furthermore, another legend states that, while he was writing, Kukai rebuked frogs and told them to be quiet because they were croaking noisily, and so frogs at Anoji-ike Pond did not croak loudly any more.

Furthermore, another legend states that, while he was writing, Kukai rebuked frogs and told them to be quiet because they were croaking noisily, and so frogs at Ajino-ike Pond did not croak loudly any more.

sen.j: 元亀元年（1570年）松永久秀が十市郡に進出、寺は一旦灰燼に帰した。
sen.e: In 1570, the temple was once burnt down, when Hisahide MATSUNAGA forayed into Toichi County.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1570, the temple was once burnt down, when Hisahide MATSUNAGA forayed into Toichi County.
In 1570, the temple was once burnt down, when Hisahide MATSUNAGA forayed into Toichi County.

sen.j: 宝暦9年（1759年）僧、恵海が再興した。
sen.e: In 1759, a monk called Ekai rebuilt it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1759, a monk called Ekai rebuilt it.
In 1759, a monk called Ekai rebuilt it.

sen.j: 方広寺の大仏再建に尽力した僧 恵美が、勧進のために大仏画を描いた。
sen.e: 僧 恵美, who contributed in rebuilding of the Great Buddha at Hoko-ji Temple, drew the Great Buddha of this temple for alms-seeking.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処『僧 恵美』読み仮名不明
sen.e: The monk 恵美, who contributed to the rebuilding of the Great Buddha at Hoko-ji Temple, painted a picture of this Great Buddha in order to raise funs for the temple.
The monk 恵美, who contributed to the rebuilding of the Great Buddha at Hoko-ji Temple, painted a picture of this Great Buddha in order to raise funds for the temple.

sen.j: その大仏画は昭和54年に(1979年)に発見されたが、そこには現在とは違う姿の大仏が描かれている。
sen.e: The painting was found in 1979, but the shape of its Great Buddha is different from the existing Great Buddha.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The painting was found in 1979, but the shape of its Great Buddha is different from the existing Great Buddha.
The painting was found in 1979, but the shape of its Great Buddha is different from the existing Great Buddha.

sen.j: 秦氏の居住地
sen.e: Habitation (area) of the Hata clan
sen.cmt: 本文の内容から、この『居住地』の意味するところは『居住地域』であると判断し、"(area)"をつけました。
sen.e: Hata Clan Residence
Hata Clan Residence

sen.j: 古来より、付近は秦氏の居住地だった。
sen.e: Since ancient times, the Hata clan has lived in this neighbourhood.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Hata clan had resided in this area since ancient times.
The Hata clan had resided in this area since ancient times.

sen.j: なかには雅楽の楽人や猿楽に関係する人たちも居た。
sen.e: Among them, there were musicians of Gagaku (old Japanese court music) and also those who were engaged in Sarugaku (old Japanese performing and entertainment arts).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処『雅楽』『猿楽』はそれぞれ括弧内に意味を訳しました。
sen.e: Among them were gagaku (old Japanese court music) musicians and people engaged in sarugaku (old Japanese performing and entertainment arts).
Among them were gagaku (old Japanese court music) musicians and people engaged in sarugaku (old Japanese performing and entertainment arts).

sen.j: 門前にある寺の説明板には、「秦楽とは、秦の楽人である」とある。
sen.e: On the temple's heritage sign before the gate it says "Jinraku means musicians of Hata".
A sign in front of the temple's gate reads 'Jinraku is Hata musicians.'
A sign in front of the temple's gate reads 'Jinraku is Hata musicians.'

sen.j: 「風姿花伝」には、当寺の前に金春流屋敷があったと記されている。
sen.e: In "Fushikaden (The Flowering Spirit)" it says that across from this temple was the residence of Konparu-ryu school of Noh-play.
In "Fushikaden" (The Flowering Spirit) it says that across from this temple was the estate of the Konparu-ryu school of noh.
In "Fushikaden" (The Flowering Spirit) it says that across from this temple was the estate of the Konparu-ryu school of noh.

sen.j: また、世阿弥は秦河勝の後裔を自認し、秦元清と自署している。
sen.e: Besides, Zeami (a famous Noh playwright and actor lived in 14th to 15th century) acknowledged that he was a descendant of HATA no Kawakatsu and signed as HATA no Motokiyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処『世阿弥』の説明を括弧内につけました。
sen.e: In addition, Zeami (a famous noh playwright and actor who lived in 14th and 15th centuries) acknowledged that he was a descendant of HATA no Kawakatsu and signed his name HATA no Motokiyo.
In addition, Zeami (a famous noh playwright and actor who lived in 14th and 15th centuries) acknowledged that he was a descendant of HATA no Kawakatsu and signed his name HATA no Motokiyo.

sen.j: 彼は近辺の出身らしい。
sen.e: He is apparently from somewhere around the area.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He is apparently from somewhere around the area.
He is apparently from somewhere around the area.

sen.j: 大和高田市にも、漢字は違うが、神楽（じんらく）という所が有る。
sen.e: There is an area called Jinraku in Yamatotakada city, but with different Kanji letter; 神楽.
sen.cmt: 漢字に意味がありますので、漢字を残しました。
sen.e: There is also an area called Jinraku in Yamatotakada City, but written using different characters (神楽).
There is also an area called Jinraku in Yamatotakada City, but written using different characters (神楽).

sen.j: 古くは秦楽とも書いた様であり、関係が注目される。
sen.e: It seems that this area was also written as 秦楽 in ancient times, which attracts attention to their relations.
sen.cmt: 漢字に意味がありますので、漢字を残しました。
sen.e: It seems that this area was also written 秦楽 in ancient times, bringing attention to a relationship between the two places.
It seems that this area was also written 秦楽 in ancient times, bringing attention to a relationship between the two places.

sen.j: また、現存していないが、付近（杜屋、村屋？：東北方向の伊与戸村のことか？）に新楽寺（しんらくじ）という寺がかってあり、関係が注目される。
sen.e: Attention is also being paid to the relations with 新楽寺 (Shinraku-ji temple) that used to exist somewhere in the neighbourhood (Moriya, Muraya?: or is it about Iyoto-mura village in the north-west direction?), though it doesn't exist anymore.
sen.cmt: 「かって」は「現存していないが」から判断しても明らかに「かつて」のタイプミスであり、ここを変更しないことには訳出が不可能でしたので、「かつて」と理解して訳しました。
sen.e: Attention is also being paid to the relationship with Shinraku-ji temple (新楽寺) that used to exist somewhere in the area (Moriya or Muraya [reading unknown] which may refer to Iyoto-mura village in the northwest) but does not exist anymore.

Attention is also being paid to the relationship with Shinraku-ji temple (新楽寺) that used to exist somewhere in the area (Moriya or Muraya [reading unknown] which may refer to Iyoto-mura village in the northeast) but does not exist anymore.

sen.j: 笠縫邑候補地
sen.e: The candidate site for Kasanui no Mura (, where the imperial ancestral deity Amaterasu Omikami was moved from the Imperial Court and worshipped by Toyosukiiribime no mikoto, before her sacred body [shintai] was transferred to Ise.)
sen.cmt: 「笠縫邑」には漢字や読み仮名及びローマ字表記だけでは推測できない意味がありますので括弧内にその意味を付記しました。
sen.e: Proposed Site of Kasanui no Mura
sen.cmt: This was far too long for a title. Moved explanation in parentheses to cell F42.
sen.e: Proposed Site of Kasanui no Mura

sen.j: 境内の南東には、春日神社と笠縫神社が並んである。
sen.e: There are Kasuga-jinja Shrine and Kasanui-jinja Shrine next to each other at the south-east side of the temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Kasuga-jinja Shrine and Kasanui-jinja Shrine stand next to each other southeast of the temple precinct.
Kasuga-jinja Shrine and Kasanui-jinja Shrine stand next to each other southeast of the temple precinct.

sen.j: 特に笠縫神社は笠縫邑の候補地の一つとされている。
sen.e: Kawanui-jinja Shrine in particular is considered as one of the candidate site for Kawanui no Mura.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Kawanui-jinja Shrine in particular is considered a possible site of Kawanui no Mura (where the imperial ancestral deity Amaterasu Omikami was moved from the Imperial Court and worshipped by Toyosukiiribime no mikoto, before being transferred to Ise).
sen.cmt: Added explanation in parentheses from cell F39.
sen.e: Kawanui-jinja Shrine in particular is considered a possible site of Kawanui no Mura (where the imperial ancestral deity Amaterasu Omikami was moved from the Imperial Court and worshipped by Toyosukiiribime no mikoto, before being transferred to Ise).

sen.j: 神仏分離令以前に見られた様な神社の中の神宮寺ではなく、寺の中に神社がある。
sen.e: Unlike Jingu-ji temples (temples associated with and built in shrines) that had seen before the Ordinance Distinguishing Shinto and Buddhism, these shrines are in a temple.
sen.cmt: 『神宮寺』の意味を括弧内に付記しました。
sen.e: Unlike jingu-ji temples (temples associated with and built in shrines) seen before the Ordinance Distinguishing Shinto and Buddhism, these are shrines that stand within a temple.
Unlike jingu-ji temples (temples associated with and built in shrines) seen before the Ordinance Distinguishing Shinto and Buddhism, these are shrines that stand within a temple.

sen.j: 交通
sen.e: Access
Access
Access

sen.j: 近畿日本鉄道近鉄橿原線笠縫駅北西約200メートル。
sen.e: About 200 meters northwest of Kasanui-eki Station, Kintetsu Sagamihara line, Kintetsu Railway.
About 200 meters northwest of KasanuiStation on the Kintetsu Sagamihara Line of the Kintetsu Railway.
About 200 meters northwest of Kasanui Station on the Kintetsu Kashihara Line of the Kintetsu Railway.
